question: WebApps are a mixture of print publishing and software development, making their development outside the realm of software engineering practice.

question: Planning ahead for software reuse reduces the cost and increases the value of the systems into which they are incorporated.
The essence of software engineering practice might be described as understand the problem, plan a solution, carry out the plan, and examine the result for accuracy.
In agile process models the only deliverable work product is the working program.

In general software only succeeds if its behavior is consistent with the objectives of its designers.

The waterfall model of software development is
answer: A reasonable approach when requirements are well defined.
options: A reasonable approach when requirements are well defined.
A good approach when a working program is required quickly.
An old fashioned model that is rarely used any more.

question: The incremental model of software development is
answer: A good approach when a working core product is required quickly.
options: A reasonable approach when requirements are well defined.
A good approach when a working core product is required quickly.
A revolutionary model that is not used for commercial products.

question: Evolutionary software process models
options: Can easily accommodate product requirements changes.
Do not generally produce throwaway systems.

question: The prototyping model of software development is
answer: A useful approach when a customer cannot define requirements clearly.
options: A reasonable approach when requirements are well defined.
A useful approach when a customer cannot define requirements clearly.
A risky model that rarely produces a meaningful product.

question: The spiral model of software development
answer: Includes project risks evaluation during each iteration.
options: Ends with the delivery of the software product.
Includes project risks evaluation during each iteration.

question: The concurrent development model is
options: Defines events that trigger engineering activity state transitions.

question: The component-based development model is
answer: Dependent on object technologies for support.
options: Only appropriate for computer hardware design.
Not able to support the development of reusable components.
Dependent on object technologies for support.

question: The formal methods model of software development makes use of mathematical methods to
options: Define the specification for computer-based systems.
Verify the correctness of computer-based systems.

question: Which of these is not one of the phase names defined by the Unified Process model for software development?

answer: Practitioner requires careful supervision by the project manager.
options: Emphasizes personal measurement of work product.
Practitioner requires careful supervision by the project manager.
Practitioner is empowered to control quality of software work products.
